definition: to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages

sentences.english: The result turned out to be sensational.
Plans for geo-engineering can sound bizarre.
sentences.chinese: 地球工程計劃可能聽起來聳人聽聞。

sentences.english: Revelations from the rest of my government database searches were less sensational.
sentences.chinese: 我在政府數據庫中搜索的其餘結果少有聳人聽聞之感。

sentences.english: This episode did not try to be as sensationalistic as the last two weeks, and the result was a much better show.
sentences.chinese: 本集沒有前兩集那麼聳人聽聞，但是卻更精彩。

sentences.english: It sits at the apex of a horrendously hierarchical and unequal society.
sentences.chinese: 它處於一個聳人聽聞的不公平的等級社會頂端。

sentences.english: The last week of the month would also be sensational for travel, near or far.
sentences.chinese: 最後一週至本月底也將聳人聽聞的旅費，或近或遠。

sentences.english: Papers of this kind are full of sensational news reports.
sentences.chinese: 這類報紙滿是聳人聽聞的新聞報道。

sentences.english: There are lots of sensationalized accounts of the trial.
sentences.chinese: 對這場審判有很多聳人聽聞的報道。

sentences.english: This is a real barnburner! Everyone will want to see it.
sentences.chinese: 這真是聳人聽聞的事情，人人都想知道。

sentences.english: The discovery of blood drinking bats only exacerbated the vampire myth.
sentences.chinese: 發現吸血蝙蝠一事令吸血鬼的傳說更加聳人聽聞。

sentences.english: The less melodramatic but more serious problem has to do with secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 不那麼聳人聽聞卻更嚴肅的問題是必須解決保密問題。

sentences.english: There are crazy people in every race that do horrific things.
sentences.chinese: 每個種族都有瘋子，幹些聳人聽聞的事情。

sentences.english: I also believe that story got sensationalised a lot in the media.
sentences.chinese: 我也相信媒體上這個故事要聳人聽聞得多。

sentences.english: This is intimidatory and completely unacceptable.
sentences.chinese: 這是聳人聽聞，讓人完全無法接受的。

sentences.english: Some people are inclined to dismiss such questions as alarmist.
sentences.chinese: 有些人傾向於將這樣的問題斥爲聳人聽聞。

sentences.english: The outrageous book created a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 那部聳人聽聞的書曾轟動一時。

definition: lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
